author: joe

review: Google continues to advertise that with the Chromecast  you can:"With Chromecast, you can easily enjoy your favorite online entertainment on your HDTV--movies, TV shows, music, and more"."Browse for what to watch, control playback, and adjust volume using your device. You won't have to learn anything new".That is blatantly a lie and fraudulent. I cannot watch Amazon Instant Video. I cannot watch websites that stream video online but that are not in the short list of what is available for Chromecast.You also cannot Browse the internet. You cannot use Firefox, Chrome or Internet Explorer. Yet all the hype surrounding Chromecast led me to believe I could. Read the hype and you will be inclined to believe the same. I really did not expect Google to be this deceptive with its advertising.If you only want Hulu or Netflix or Youtube then great device and cheap but I don't use any of them, I use Amazon for Streaming and this doesn't work with Amazon. I also hoped that I could watch a few of the websites that stream only online but I cannot. Sure there are all kinds of workarounds and other software but that is not what I expected to have to do.I am returning the Chromecast and really disappointed with Google, did not expect this kind of overhype from them.

author: Brennan

review: This product could be great however the difficulty of getting it into a secure networking environment is not worth the hassle. I'm not a super networking guy, but my skill set is slightly above average.It would not connect to an ATT Uverse modem no matter how many settings I changed, it could not get through the firewall. Once I connected it to my Linksys router (unsecured guest network), it would work, however it will not link to a non broadcasting SSID. You also have to enable multicast with no wireless isolation, etc etc etc....Bought a Roku, connected it to the non broadcasting network SSID and BAM! Done!.....Much more mature, easy product to configure, easy to use and gets prime amazon along with 700+ channels. Only bad Roku input so far is user interface kind of stinks, but its tolerable.Goodbye cable company! Hello Roku!
author: Nugget

review: Functionality: Streams web, I said WEB content to your TV through apps like YouTube. It will take 5-20 seconds before showing your video stream to the TV. There is a way to play local files i.e. movies off your computer.Setup: Device connects physically to TV through HDMI and wirelessly to your wireless network. My TV requires it to has the USB plugged in at all times. Not sure if required to do so. It was relatively easy. Plug in. Change "channel" to HDMI for TV. Download app. Connect to Google Chromecast device. Use selected app to stream.Available Apps: YouTube, Hulu Plus, HBO Go, Pandora, Netflix, Google Play Movies, Google Play Music, VEVO, Red Bull TV, Songza, Plex, Viki, Real Player Cloud, Avia, Revision3, Beyond Pod.Value: Worth it. Would be nice to see a functionality where you can play local files from your phone.... I like wireless and detests wires so that it that.
author: ProcrastinatingZombie

review: The chromecast is one of the easiest and most useful home entertainment devices I used to date. Having an AppleTV and PS3 at home, I have many options, but I continually come back to the chromecast. Anyone can 'cast' their favorite Pandora station, and the system works well with iOS, Android, Mac, and WIndows products since the chromecast uses the existing WiFi network at your home.Setup is quite easy, and I was up and running within 2-3 minutes following the easy guidelines provided with the product. Although many of the computer casting options remain in beta, they seem to work quite well.iOS has many apps that allow your phone to 'cast' to the device: Netflix, Pandora, Youtube, Songza, and HBO Go to name a few that I use most often. I highly recommend this device, especially if someone is considering buying a Roku, AppleTV, or other internet streaming device.
